these shot tracks. And inside these shot
tracks are shots, right? But each of
these shots is just another level
sequence. Level sequences within level
sequences within level sequences. We end
up calling them subsequences when
they're nested in there. But
functionally, there is not like an
actual difference or, you know, type of
asset that a subsequence needs to be.
They're all just level sequences. We
just call them subsequences because it's
shorter, easier to say. It tells you
more about what their purpose is.

builds up and collectively adds to the
shot as a whole. And so that's one of
the benefits of having these things
broken up into what we call subsequences
is that it gives you more control over
